lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Angela.Angela.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Angela.Angela.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
// Update the title above to match the actual product name
// Describe the action and its outcome.
// A description of the expected outcome goes here
* Constructs an instance of the Angela class with the specified file path.
* This constructor initializes the `listData` and `database` fields after a delay of 10 seconds.
* The `listData` is initialized as a new `TaskList` object, and the `database` is initialized
* as a new `Database` object using the provided file path and the `listData`.
* @param filePath The path to the file that will be used by the `Database` for storage or retrieval.
*                 This path is passed to the `Database` constructor.
* Continuously reads input from the user and processes chat commands.
* The input is stripped of leading and trailing whitespace before being processed.
* The method runs indefinitely in a loop, handling chat commands via the chatResponse method.
* Prints onto the terminal when a user first initiated Angela.
* Utilised setTimeout method to provide a more realistic experience.
* ASCII art depicts Angela. from Lobotomy Corp.
Welcome, Manager. I am your assistant AI, Angela.
I am here to support you as it's your first day.
I will provide practical advice and emotional support until you get used to your work.
public static void setTimeout(Runnable runnable, int delay){
* UI class to handle display of responses in the console.
* Displays response in a simple 2 line UI.
* @param response The string to be displayed.
* Displays an error message in a simple UI. A line of asterisks is displayed
* to differentiate normal responses to error messages.
* @param e The exception whose message is to be displayed.
* Displays an error message in a simple UI. A line of asterisks is displayed
* to differentiate normal responses to error messages. This is an overloaded
* method to handle exceptions not declared in Angela (e.g IOException), in
* which it will take in special message as a string instead of exception.
* @param e the exception message to be printed on the console.
* Represents an exception that is thrown when an invalid command
* is issued in the chat response process.
* Returns a string representation of the exception,
* indicating that an invalid command was issued and suggesting
* @return A string representation of the exception.
return "Invalid command. Check the manual again Manager.";
* Represents an exception that is thrown when there is an attempt
* to print a list that is empty.
* Returns a string representation of the exception,
* indicating that no data has been stored in the database.
* @return A string representation of the exception.
return "No data has been stored in the database.";
* Exception thrown when an invalid syntax is used for the find command.
* Returns a string representation of the exception, indicating that the syntax for the find command is invalid.
* @return a string representation of the exception
return "Invalid syntax for find command. Please check the manual again Manager.";
* Exception thrown when an error occurs during the printing of list items.
* Returns a string representation of the exception, indicating that an error occurred while printing list items.
* @return a string representation of the exception
* Exception thrown when an unreadable entry is encountered in the database file.
* Constructs a new UnreadableFileException with the specified line number.
* @param lineNum the line number of the unreadable entry
* Returns a string representation of the exception, indicating the line number of the unreadable entry.
* @return a string representation of the exception
return String.format("Database contains an uninterpretable entry at line %d.\n", this.lineNum);
* Exception thrown when an attempt is made to create a task with an end date and time
* that is earlier than the start date and time.
* Returns a string representation of the exception,
* indicating that the end date and time cannot be earlier than the start date and time.
* @return a string representation of the exception
return "End date and time cannot be earlier than the start date and time. We are not in a time loop.";
* Represents an exception that is thrown when a task is created with an empty detail.
* Returns a string representation of the exception,
* indicating that the task description cannot be empty.
* @return A string representation of the exception.
* Exception thrown when an invalid date is provided during task creation.
* Returns a string representation of the exception.
* This includes the error message indicating the correct date and time syntax.
* @return a string representation of the exception
return "Invalid date. Please enter the date and time in syntax yyyy-mm-dd HH:mm.";
* Represents an exception that is thrown when a task creation command
// The command with the invalid syntax.
* Constructs an InvalidSyntaxException with the specified command.
* @param cmd The command with the invalid syntax.
* Returns a string representation of the exception,
* indicating the invalid syntax for the specific command.
* @return A string representation of the exception.
return String.format("Invalid syntax for %s command. Check the manual again Manager.", cmd);
* Exception thrown when an error occurs during the creation of a new task.
* Returns a string representation of the exception, indicating that an error occurred while creating new tasks.
* @return a string representation of the exception
* Represents an exception that is thrown when an invalid index is accessed
// The size of the task list.
* Constructs an InvalidIndexException with the specified list size.
* @param listSize The size of the task list.
* Returns a string representation of the exception,
* which includes a message indicating the invalid index and the size of the task list.
* @return A string representation of the exception.
return "Invalid index. There are " + listSize + " task(s) in the database.";
* Represents an exception that is thrown when attempting to modify
* a task list that is empty.
* Returns a string representation of the exception,
* indicating that the task list is empty and instructing the manager to create a task first.
* @return A string representation of the exception.
return "No task has been created. Create one first Manager.";
* Represents a generic exception that occurs during task modification.
* Returns a string representation of the exception,
* indicating an error occurred while modifying the task list.
* @return A string representation of the exception.
* Represents an exception that is thrown when the syntax used
* for modifying a task is incorrect.
* Returns a string representation of the exception,
* indicating that the rank of the list item to be modified should be entered,
* and that negative numbers are not accepted.
* @return A string representation of the exception.
return "Enter the rank of the list item you want to modify. Negative number is not accepted.";

* Constructs a new Database instance, initializes the storage path,

* The input must follow a specific syntax: "<action> <taskIndex>".

* If the task index is invalid or out of bounds, an InvalidIndexException is thrown.

* @throws WrongSyntaxException if the input syntax is incorrect
* @throws ListEmptyException if the list data is empty
